summary.text_en: Euclid is 'Father of Geometry'! His 'Elements' is most influential mathematics work in history. Starting from 5 simple axioms, using rigorous logic to derive entire geometry system. This book used for 2300 years, second only to Bible in print copies!

story.text_en: Around 300 BC, Euclid taught mathematics in Alexandria. Legend says King Ptolemy asked: 'Is there shortcut to learning geometry?' Euclid replied: 'There is no royal road to geometry.' Meaning even kings must learn step by step, no shortcuts. He collected and organized predecessors' mathematical knowledge, writing 'Elements' with rigorous logical system, 13 books containing 465 propositions.

fun_facts.text_en: 'Elements' is world's second bestseller after Bible, printed over 1000 editions!
Until early 20th century, Western schools still used 'Elements' as geometry textbook.
His saying 'no royal road to geometry' to king became famous quote in education history.
Almost no records of Euclid's life exist, even birth and death dates uncertain!

experiment.description_en: Euclid provided rigorous proof of Pythagorean theorem in 'Elements'. He constructed clever diagram: drawing squares on all three sides of right triangle. Through area relationship derivation, proved square on hypotenuse equals sum of squares on other two sides. This proof demonstrated elegance and power of geometric reasoning, becoming one of most famous proofs in mathematics history.
experiment.why_en: Through geometric figure area relationships, can intuitively prove algebraic equations - this is geometry's charm.

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine playing with building blocks. Euclid says: 'I give you 5 basic blocks (axioms), then tell you how to assemble.' Starting from these 5 blocks, he teaches you step-by-step to build all possible shapes. Each step has strict rules, no randomness. Most amazing: using just these 5 basic blocks and assembly rules, can construct entire geometry edifice! This is mathematics' beauty.

impact.text_en: 'Elements' one of most influential textbooks in human history! It not only laid geometry foundation, more importantly established 'axiomatic deductive system' - from few axioms, logically deriving entire knowledge system. This method influenced all science and philosophy, becoming paradigm of rational thinking. Newton's 'Principia' imitated Euclidean system.

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Euclid synthesized mathematical achievements of predecessors like Pythagoras, Plato, Eudoxus, establishing complete geometry system. Archimedes developed applied geometry on this foundation. Descartes invented analytic geometry, combining geometry with algebra. Newton imitated Euclidean axiomatic method writing 'Principia'. In 19th century, Gauss and others discovered non-Euclidean geometry, breaking Euclidean parallel postulate, opening new mathematical fields.

quiz.question_en: What is the foundation of Euclidean geometry?
quiz.explanation_en: Euclidean geometry built on foundation of 5 axioms (postulates). These axioms are self-evident basic assumptions, like 'two points determine a line', 'all right angles equal', etc. From these 5 axioms, through rigorous logical reasoning, can prove all geometric theorems. This 'axiomatic deductive system' is paradigm of mathematics and science.
